review: Came here with my girlfriends for our weekly dinner. I wouldn't normally pick Chili's for a restaurant but none of us could make our minds so someone made the decision for us. We got here right around 5:30pm, not to many people there yet for dinner. I completely forgot about our servers name but he was good! Service was great. Took our drink orders and they were always full. We were able to order our food right away. 2 of us ordered entree from their 2 for $22 menu which was nice so we basically got a free appetizer. I ordered the 6oz sirloin which came with loaded mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli. It wasn't the best steak I have ever had but it wasn't the worst. Although we had a pleasant experience I don't think I would come back.

I ordered a Santa Fe crispers salad just a few minutes ago and look what I've got? A big stem and no avocado slices. They come with avocado slices right? I put the stem on top so you can see it clearly.

Some of the reviews on here are laughable. I've been coming to this chili's for YEARS & they are by far the best! There's hardly ever a wait time, they always say 15-20 minutes but I never feel like it really takes that long. Chips & salsa are BOMB. white spinach queso BOMB. nachos super bomb. The servers are always super nice & very attentive. I love the loaded boneless wings (I ask for extra cheese though) because some of the cooks do leave some stuff kinda dry. This is my favorite restraunt and the prices are reasonable! If you want great service & good food this is the place to go!

Came in for lunch at 2. Cruz was my waitress. Received a slightly cold burger and cold wings. I said I wanted to keep my burger and not wait for the remake. Remade the wings and comped the cold ones and the hot ones. She made a big deal about comping something other than the one set of wings which totaled to cover the cost of the hot set of wings. I ordered an iced tea and she did not refill it once. I asked for mayo and each after receiving my slightly cold Burger almost five minutes after I got it when she stop by. She brought the ranch. Another few minutes later I ate my burger with a soggy bun. No discount on the burger. Tipped $2.50, slightly under 15% to show my frustration

Amazing happy hour. Sat in the bar area. Very chill environment. Chips and salsa are my fav. Ordered the fajita special, delish! Waitress was awesome, forgot to get her name but she was very pleasant and attentive.

Good service for being super busy here on a Friday. Friendly servers. Food was great. I had the cajon pasta. I was so hungry I forgot to take a before photo. I ate it all... guess I'm gonna hit the gym hard tomorrow. 1100 calories !

2nd time in a row now with bad service at this chili's. This is the worst chili's I've been to. Their service is terrible! Long wait times to get a server to take the order and even longer for the food to arrive once the server takes our order. I can see why if they're busy but we went on a non peak time, and the restaurant was pretty empty. our server never gave us updates or reassure us that our food was on the way. We asked for a straw and never got one, not asking for much just a straw...... This last time, we had to walk out because we got so tired of waiting for our food. The food is not all that great to be worth the wait. I don't ever plan on coming back to this chili's if I can help it!

I took my family to dine at Chili's. Chilies used to be good don't know what happened, but the server was terrible bad attitude and the food was horrible and to make matters worse the manager brought it out and if he didn't see anything wrong with it that says a lot about their management and their kitchen. The food looked like it was microwavable.. The mini burgers were so dry and hard to bite, the pasta with chicken had no flavor and the salad some of the items looked like they were already decomposing and my enchilada platter well the rice looked and tasted four days old the beans dry flavorless probably because of the microwave. I regret taking my family. Not going back!
New dinner menu, horrible food.  Ribs and chicken tasted like fish.  Going downhill quick.

Giving them two stars is VERY generous. I don't remember our waitresses name (for obvious reasons). We went in for Veterans Day with my husband who had just retired from the USMC and our waitress was high as a kite. Her excuse was that she was called in early. She didn't write down our order and brought us the wrong food and drinks numerous times. My husband ordered a beer and drank half of it. She proceeded to tell him he had "better drink that G** damn beer", in front of my very religious father, who had been very tolerant thus far. Lucky enough, the manager offered us a whole 15% off of our bill and some coupons for our "next visit". Not happy.

Chili's used to be my favorite restaurant a few years ago but has fallen off mostly due to menu changes and policies.  I still am a big fan of the Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers.  I love that honey chipotle sauce! I was a fan of the big mouth burgers with the extra thick cut bacon.  I see that they are making attempts to get some appealing burgers back on the menu but the extra thick cut bacon is missing.  I used to order ribs al-a-carte but they stopped allowing that years ago.  It was nice to add some ribs to pair with a steak.   Chili's French Fries are better than most but they give much less than they used to.  On my last visit there were only two servers working in the restaurant late in the evening.  My server fell behind but did a good job considering the lack of staff.  I still come to Chili's but not near as often as I used to.
The service was great! Manny took care of us and made the visit great. The chef could not cook a steak. Go see Manny
Dinner was great, the service was phenomenal and our server/bartender was very attentive and I loved her recommendations!

Worst service ever. The hostess were lost took them an hour and a half to seat us. I know we are a large party (21) but we had mentioned like 3 times we could be split up. Party's of 4 and 5 were sat before us although again we could be split up. The hostess was more worried about disrupting the servers sections then accommodating us. After waiting to be sat for an hour and a half only one server was serving us. All appetizer orders were given to the wrong people no drinks on one side of table then when they checked on what they had dropped off they said the kitchen was backed up. I asked 3 times for chips and salsa what does the kitchen have to do with chips and salsa? When they finally brought them they added "they were given to the other side of the table" well that's great to tell your customer. Appetizers came out 5 min before our food (no room for both on table). My sisters onion rings were burned. Why would they serve burned food?!?!? Also I tried flagging the manager but he kept ignoring me. I knew he seen me but chose to ignore me instead. I am never going back to this chilies. They advertise to come with your party and have a good time but can't accommodate a birthday party. They could've had to serves help us but that would disturb the servers sections I guess they decided it wasn't worth it. We were very patient and even then our food was wrong and took forever to get to the table. The server was doing the best he could but management should have stepped in.

So I spend $30 for a 14z rib eye at Wood Ranch on the fourth and am horribly disappointed (not 14z and charred). Next day I try Chilis and order the rib eye. Said to be 11-14z, but at only $18 with 2 excellent sides. The steak was thick so as to be cooked med rare. The steak was quality and not charred. This is a great value and another hit by this Chilis. Not sure what they have done in the past but they are one of the best chain restaurants in the City. The service was excellent (Marin) but their corporate people need to bring back buss staff. Let your servers do their job and focus on us the customers.

Chili's is awesome! Unfortunately, our food wasn't the way we wanted it, and they took it back and brought it back. Then my meal wasn't right so they took it back and kinda took forever. I talked to a manager and Eric did more than help me out. He had great customer service and just made the whole experience a lot better! A lot of the things wrong we're out of his hands, yet he went out of his way to help us out and totally exceeded our expectations. Thank you Eric!

Fairly standard Southwestern cuisine.  Fresh ingredients, nice presentation, always tasty.  Jacob was our server.  He did a great job.  Thanks Jacob!  We ordered the Triple Dipper and a kid's mac and cheese.  Plenty of food for our family.  Kids were happy and ate everything.  iPads are a great distraction for the little ones. Bathrooms are clean and nicely kept.  All in all, I'd recommend Chili's, especially for the family dining crowd.

I have been visiting this location since it opened. Over the years, changes have been made to the menu (corporate decisions, of course) that have not made me happy. However, the staff at this location have always been friendly, attentive, and even accomodating to my family's needs/requests.
Matt was our waiter today and he was great! Fast service and really nice, it's been a while since I've had a nice outing and this was defiantly worth it! Thanks!
We had a Great time celebrating my Nephews Birthday today. Amanda did an Amazing job considering our party consisted of 20 plus.  Thank you Chillis for makings this a memorable Birthday Dinner.

Always have a good consistent experience with the staff and the food. Always get what we expected and am never disappointed . It's not gourmet food but we definitely enjoy it. Great for a quick sit down meal with no hassles.
Our waitress Emily was friendly and made sure that we were well taken care of. Definitely one of the better Chili's establishments I've been to

Usually quick seating, good choice of food items and the wait staff is usually really good and quick. They have begun to be a little stingy with the sauces and stuff but if you ask for extra it is no problem.

My boy Mike always kills it! He's the best waiter and is always attentive and always make sure my drink is refilled, he makes sure everyone is happy and always has their food! 12/10 for mike. HOWEVERR, today I went and got a different waiter, David. He wasn't as attentive, didn't refill our drinks, and probably only showed up 3 times the whole time we were eating. He didn't even feel bad when I told him he forgot my mashed potatoes, and only apologized after the manager was informed. However I'm still giving it 5/5 because my boy mike always kills it. Guess everyone can't be as good as mike ‍

GET IN MY BELLY!  Chili's is one of my all time favorite places to eat. They have the yummiest chips and salsa for surper cheap. Grub outttttttttttttttt since its unlimited  Texas cheese fries are a good small bite if you aren't hungry for a full on meal, or one of their salads would do. But my all time favorite favorite favorite dish, is the Cajun Chicken Pasta. I order this with the chicken on the side, then add broccoli, and lastly add grilled shrimp. And let me say, this creation is Divine!!!!!!!! The type of Alfredo sauce that they use has such a great flavor, and I could have seriously licked my bowl when I finished my pasta. The broccoli was steamed perfectly, and tasted amazing when dipped into the Alfredo sauce. The shrimp was grilled, and seasoned to my satisfaction. The fresh tomatoes on top- that was the icing on the cake! Sooooo happy, like many times before.  One complaint about our visit today though, our Cajun pastas both came with burnt bread. Like it was black looking and when you bit into it, you wanted to spit it right back out because it even tasted burnt. We were sad about that because usually the bread is so yummy! Will come back for my Cajun chicken pasta

I came here with my friend and we overall enjoyed our experience. We had a great server but I felt bad because he was the only one on the floor and he had a lot of tables. Management needs to work on making sure they staff the dinner shifts properly. Other than that, our food tasted awesome and we had good service. I recommend the Texas cheese fries as an appetizer. The 2 for $22 deal is my go-to.

The restaurant was clean and we got seated quickly for a Friday afternoon. Just that our waiter wasn't checking up on us often and that wasn't too bad but just to get out check which we had a gift card and he had to do the transaction from his end it took too long. Which we just made it for our movie we were going to watch.

I use to be a regular here until one of the servers snatched the kiosk from my sons (8 yr. old) hands, which prompted me to leave. I took a picture of the server she then snatched my phone from my hand, and began yelling at me in the restaurant. The manager saw it and did nothing. I called numerous times to file a complaint, nothing was ever done. Therefore I no longer visit Chillis.

Called and did take out appitisers Nacho's n cheese bites Sight said 8:05 picked up at 8 Got home at 8:12  Nachoes dicinigrated mind you in the restauret are good everything was cold Not impressed will not do again
Love this chillis! So far have been here several times over the past 3 years and service and food is always amazing! Never disappointed!

We were unable to get a booth or half booth/table for 5 guest at 1:49 pm.  Brad refused to make accommodations even though they weren't busy. He sat us in the middle of the restaurant. We offered to wait and showed him some other areas that we'd prefer, but he wouldn't adjust. We left and now we are giving our money to Wood Ranch! So much better!!  Thanks Brad! Lunch at Wood Ranch was delicious!!

I was very surprise to enjoy our lunch here. I got the turkey sandwich and I loved it so that's 1 star. The service was good, nothing to complain about. The reason for the low rating is that when we walked it no one greeted us because no one was in the front. It seems like they were under staffed. Not sure if it was on purpose because there either slow or the company is that greedy they want to save labor hours. We were waiting a good while like 3-5 minutes just standing there being ignored. Once we were seated once again I noticed they had very few servers. Making it seem like they were short staffed. This is the second time I've noticed this and it's a bad move. Not only am I hesitant to ask my server for something, but when I did ask for something it took a while for her to get it because she had so many tables. The bad thing about this is that it made us feel like just another tip, instead of being able to interact with the guest and create a friendly atmosphere. Instead it felt rushed and tensed. I hope they can work on this.

I would like to write a review about the food and service but never got an opportunity.  Through the window you can see most of the booths an tables were empty but when you walked around to the front, there were was a large crowd of people waiting.  We put our name in and were told it was a 30 min wait.  We had two little ones and it's cold outside (no room inside to wait), so we went back in after 10 mins to see where we were on time and were told 35 min.  That was our que to leave.  You are open on a holiday and don't have the staff to run your business?  Saw several people walk away.  You lost a lot of money today.  Maybe you should work on your staffing.

Server hardly ever smiled, at any of her tables, and this place is stingy with their marketing tactics (coupons). It's like you don't get great business by always saying NO! Apparently you can't use a free kids meal "award" with a free dessert coupon. Those are two different marketing items, I know because I use to do the books for a corporate well known and popular restaurant. ;)

Absolutely terrible service. We waited 40 mins to seat a family of 5, which was understandable because it was a Saturday night. When we were finally seated, our waiter Robert took our drink order then our food order at 8:20. We waited, and waited, and waited for our food to come. We waited a total of 50 minutes for our food. Robert never once came by to check if we needed anything or give us updates. Instead, i saw him sitting in a booth talking to a coworker. I finally had to get up myself and ask to speak to the manager to get an update on our food. When our food finally came, our drinks were watered down and my daughter's lemonade was completely empty. In the total of 2 hours that we were here, Robert still didn't once come by to ask if we needed anything, not even a refill. However, the manager was friendly and apologetic. Finally came time to pay, stopped Robert to hand him the check, and still took him forever to come back with the change. Ridiculous.

The menus were sticky and filthy. Who knows when the last time they wiped it down. Yuck! Mentioned it to the manager I don't think he gave a sh*t, he still gets paid. I hope corporate sees this post. Gosh,really please clean your menus, that was disgusting. Take some pride. I worked food service in my younger days. My manager emphasis to make sure our menus where wiped clean.

This place was horrible. I had the chicken avocado bacon sandwich. Bread was disgusting as was the lettuce. Hardly any chicken or bacon or avocado. Another person in my party had a salad and said it was awful. We had the chips and guacamole and the chips were oily skinny and all stuck together. They have that iPad looking thing where you can order. You would think they would baby wipe it or something after each customer. The thing was disgusting. Only giving a 1 star because I have to and the waitress was good. Anyway never had bad food at a chilis before. Never going to this chilis again. The one in Mission Grove area of Riverside is delicious.

So... we decided to stop at this chilli's to celebrate our daughters 15th birthday.... it was a BAD idea! First off, let me just say our waiter was friendly(why I gave two stars) we were seated after waiting about 30 minutes(we are a family of 6) so I thought... well not that bad... our waiter took our drink order... I told him we were doing the two for $35 dinner and a two for $22 dinner so I wanted to place the order for our appetizers (which I then did) we got our drinks in about 10 minutes... our appetizers took about 20 minutes... and our waiter was no where in site to take our food order... I honestly don't know how long it was... but let's just say... we had finished our appetizers and already needed drink refills before he came and took our dinner orders. When we placed our order... he then said "I punched in your order already so it got sent to the back... I don't know when it will be out... but it will be out" and he left to wait on the other many many many tables he was assigned to!!! Our food took very long to come out... within the time waiting for it... I had to flag down many other employees (which all rushed past our table and seemed not to have noticed me while I raised my hand and yelled excuse me!) I finally got one waiters attention... and we even asked what was going on... he then replied "we have a new system which means us waiters basically do less.. we just take your orders and now we have food bussers that bring out the food to you... us waiters got more tables to cover now since we don't have to bring out the food any more... but all orders must be placed with your waiter" so I then told him... well I don't see our waiter to place our refill drink orders and I also haven't received my house salad which I placed that order over 25 minutes ago!! So he then said he'd get it all for us... right when our waiter magically appeared!!! How convenient!! I got my salad right away after speaking to both waiters along with our refills... so... when our food finally came... 3 food bussers came and handed out plates all in a rush and rushed off before we could even say a word!!! Again our waiter was no where to be found!!! And every employee (food bussers and waiters) that past our table had me waving and yelling excuse me... as they all rushed by and some how couldn't hear nor see me!!! It was about 35 minutes... when I decided to stand up and was gonna walk to the kitchen!!! Right when a female food busser sees me and that's when I tell her in my frustrated voice that my food is now ice cold cause it had been sitting there for over 30 minutes under an ac that was aiming right at our table... I couldn't eat my food nor my kids had eaten theirs since we had no ranch for their chicken strips or fries... my husband and I had no A1 sauce or Tabasco sauce for our steaks... and no butter for our broccoli!!! She said she'd bring it out... she did within 10 minutes... I cut into my steak and guess what??!!! It was well done when I ordered medium!!! My husbands was rare when he ordered medium!!! I was done at that point... and I know our waiter noticed... because when he magically appeared to take our dessert order that came with our $35 meal...he asked if we were ok... I know I looked pissed... my husband gave me his look like don't ruin our daughters birthday dinner ... so I said we are ok!!! He brought us boxes and our dessert within 10 minutes and we seemed to see him a lot right before we left... wish it would of been that way the entire time!!! We didn't even get to let them know it was our daughters 15th birthday!!! I'm so upset and disappointed! We are Hispanic... a girls 15th birthday is suppose to be special... and this was horrible!!! It was a train wreck! I'm so disappointed with this establishment ... I think we would of gotten better service and hotter food at Denny's at this point! $102 we spent... $102 on cold food... that wasn't how  we ordered!!! What a way to ruin a girls 15 birthday!!!

When you find a screw in your chips..... It started out pretty good tonight. Our waiter was kind and attentive....and I want to make sure that it is known that he was great. It was the food at the end of the day that left much to be desired. Then it got super busy....we know because he told us. He was still kind and attentive but a few other things occurred. My daughter found a screw....like a 1/2 inch full screw at the bottom of the basket of chips. Quite alarming!! The kids food came out pretty decent. Our fajitas came out undercooked. The shrimp was fine but the veggies were still raw....didn't send back because at this point I just wanted to be done. A different waitress brought out the kids Sprite refills, stood at the end of the table and said, "You have Sprites??" I said yes the three kids at the end...she set all of them down at the far end (full size mugs without kids) of the table and just left them there. Didn't hand them out so the kids had to get up and hand them out themselves. I get you're busy....but come on!! Thank goodness for the mango margarita is all I have to say. I am sad to post this as this is our local Chilis and we have always been served fairly well. Super disappointed and questioning whether we will come back

Went to happy hour today. Nothing haply about it. Literally only one person was working. Some girl was helping out at times then sitting and chatting with coworkers eating there.  Place is super understaffed. The bartender was very nice but way too busy. I felt bad for her. Management should work on better service. I wanted a water after my drink. Never was i asked for anything else. The wings were super acidic. This was just all bad.  Sorry i will not be coming back. Tgif is way better

The bartender Carrie is rude and is very un with it in simple terms we came in as a party of seven sat at the bar and she took two drink orders instead of all seven of us we waited 10 minutes for her to attend to us. Then she only took one appetizer order left put it in then ignored us then came back kept ignoring us the finally came back room one order again and left instead of AGAIN taking all seven orders.! So we could eat and drink together and leave together! She obviously needs MORE TRAINING! simply sad.  Sorry Chilli's  it's a thumbs down this time.

I come here at least once a month. It's usually always perfect. Well today my waiter plan flat out sucked. 2 black berry iced teas came as regular iced teas. My beer came to the table about 20 minutes after I ordered it and can you say warm beer that was only 70% full. Then are meals came and we ordered 2 loaded mashed well both plates came out with regular. Are server came to the table once. And are fries we're cold. I didn't even take a sip of my beer nor did we even eat and our server just kept walking by. So I just simply asked for a box paid and left. I will be coming back I just now know never to have this waiter serve me again.

I don't come here often. They offer a variety of cheap appetizer for happy hours for about $5 NACHOS, rating 2/5 It was not the best nachos. I prefer don Jose's nachos better although it costs twice as much. These ones came in about 7pieces and it looked more like tiny slices of pizzas. Thick and filled with cheese, jalapeños sprinkled on top. MANGO MARGARITA 4/5  I love this drink !!! Its filled with fruity citrus flavors and the handle the size of 16oz beers. I was impressed with the flavor really, it had a good amount of alcohol in for the mix.  SERVICE 5/5 Our server was superb and cute. He was very humorous even when it was late and he was tired he still came by very often to check in on his. Constantly making sure we had everything we needed and making us comfortable. An extra point for not forgetting my lemons in the water :)

Service was just "ok". My servers name was Michael and I asked him if I could use a coupon I had that expired a few days ago. He said"no" I'm like bs.. Another location did it no problem he just didn't want too even though I knew they could.. Oh well it's all good I do agree with a previous review this location has a lot of noisy kids.. The food was good which is why I gave it 3 stars.

It's just Chili's so I don't expect much but I at least want my food to be cooked properly and not just microwaved. I ordered a ribeye steak medium rare and got a rubbery steak microwaved to welldone. I wanted to flag someone down so they could maybe make this right, but there was no one to be found. Wont be coming here again.

I've been to this Chili's multiple times, but the last two times left a lot to be desired. The first time we were our waiter treated us like a nuisance and when we told them it was my friend's birthday the waiter asked us if we were sure we wanted to bother because it was only a scoop of ice cream. The second time we were completely ignored along with three other tables around us. My daughter got her kid's quesadilla first and after 30 minutes we had to go to the front of the restaurant and ask the manager if the rest of our food was going to come and when it did it was cold. We saw our waitress twice which was when she brought us our drinks and our check. We definitely won't be returning.
I miss my old Chilis and my favorite bar tender, but still a great place to enjoy margaritas.
I have been to this chillis plenty of time and never had a bad experience. The food is good and the customer service was good as well. I ordered the Cajun chicken  pasta and it was delish.

Went on lunch break and sat in the bar area.  15 minutes after being seated, people came in and sat behind us.  After 55 minutes, inquiring twice in that time about where our food was, our order comes and my order is wrong.  As I am waiting to flag the waiter down to let him know, we notice the couple that came in 15 minutes after us, ordered the same fajitas, had already received their food, ate, and paid and left.  Not sure what took mine so long?  So I send the food back and tell the waiter I'm now out of time and simply need the bill for my husband's food.  This took another 10 mins.  So I'm standing up to go ask for a manager because I need to leave at this point.  Up walks Eric.  He was terrible.  His attitude has no business dealing with the public.  Very unprofessional and defensive.  This is the 2nd time I've waited an hour for my food here.  I will never return.

Hadn't been to any Chili's in well over a year so we were pleasantly surprised when we came to this one with a gift card.  We arrived before 5 pm on a Wednesday (we have a little one) so it wasn't super busy.  Our waiter, Brian, was very attentive and friendly with our 18 mo old as she tried to get his attention.   I know they went through a sort of "re-branding" lately and it worked:  great mix of tex-mex/sandwiches/burgers, clean environment, and the tablets on the table are a nice touch.  Stacked restaurants has used them since its inception but Chili's has a good blend where you have a traditional waiter but can use the tablet to browse menus, specials, and play games (for $0.99).  Not a huge fan of chain restaurants, but this one is running its parent company's business model to a T.  I even had an issue with a urinal that was resolved immediately.  Well run, friendly people, and especially good for happy hour prices.

My family and I typically go to this particular Chilli's because it's closer to home. Today, the service was absolutely slow. My family and I go here a lot and the service has never been this slow. We placed a simple order and nothing out of ordinary. Thank goodness they had NFL ticket to occupy everyone's attention away from there hunger. I'm guessing they were short staffed in the kitchen. The servers practically apologized  every  5 -10mins  for the wait. Overall the food came out great.

Wow.   I used to love Chili's.  They need to fire their cook (I won't call him a chef).  First, I ordered the loaded potato soup.....  the color threw me off,  it was yellow ... wtf?  Im sorry the cheese was not mixed in so why yellow.  I eat this dish every where I go...never yellow.  Never the less,  I tried it.....not horrible but not good, I choked it down because I was hungry...lucky thing I did because... Next, I ordered the pick 3 tacos... I got Ranchero Taco, Spicy Shrimp Taco and Prime Rib Taco.  I took one bite of each and set them back.  (I rarely send food back).   The Ranchero tasted like someone threw a bucket of salt on it,  The Prime Rib Taco tasted like rubber,   way overcooked,  the spicy shrimp?  they might want to rename it because I couldn't find the shrimp....I had to open it up and dig threw it to find 3 EXTREMELY small shrimp... 3.. a good name for it would have been the cole slaw taco. The beans were bland and the rice?  I have no words except... Could you use that thing called spice or flavor?  I will never be back unless I hear they fired the cook.  Sad,  the menu sounded so appetizing and the waitress was cool but none of that matters if you have a schmuck in the kitchen.
I love the 2 for $20 deal, my bf and I also loved playing the games on the iPad while waiting for our food! Our waiter was great too!

There is this one girl that works here and I love her she is the sweetest person! Her name is Cassandra she always talks to me and is very smart and she always recommends great things to try I appreciate her she's a hard worker when you go there as for her she's a great gal!
Good food, good beer, great service.. But bring jacket and gloves.. It's an ICEBOX!!!!!  It's a Wed night about 10pm almost New Year's Eve and really think it may be colder in here than outside!

Bad experience. Had to leave hungry.  We sought the place out, knew what we wanted, arrived at opening.  They tried to seat us beside the only other guests in the building. We asked for another spot.  We tried to place our order on first approach, a black bean burger we had gotten there before that was off the menu. She presented us with options, directing us to the menu, it was confusing. By the third time she tried to take our order we had more questions than answers. She referred to the menu as a novel. I think she was overselling us, not in dollars, but pressure just the same, we felt frustrated and decided to go somewhere else. This was a deal she should have closed with a smile!
I got seated rite away in the bar area but had almost no service and I was served Warm beer and it took over 45 mins to get my appetizers.

We have been coming to this Chili's since they first opened.  Unfortunately our experiences here, lately, have not been stellar. We were there this past Sunday-arriving just after 5:30 or so. We were quoted about a 20 minute wait and it was actually a little less. Great start, right? We were a party of 5. 3 women 2 in their 50's and 1 in her 70's, 14 y/o girl and 5 y/o boy.  After we were seated we noticed that the temp in the room was pretty cold-colder than outside. This does tend to be the norm in Corona-I jokingly say I am going to start bringing a blanket when we go out!  After we placed our order I mentioned the temp to our server and she said she would check into it. A few minutes later, the manager, Jeff, stopped by our table.  He was very personable and explained that the air wasn't on, it was just the fan. However as we were talking the air from the vent (right over our table) seemed less cold. He said he would check to make sure the air wasn't on on and I think he most have because after that the temp was fine. We ordered 2 of the $20 dinners for the 4 adults/teens and the small one ordered pizza.  Chips and guacamole and fried cheese were our appetizers. My sister noted the time we ordered since we have had problems with long delays here in teh past (my last visit our food was served late and cold and we didn't get any silverware-really!-that meal was a complete comp!) Chips, salsa and guacamole and cheese came pretty quick along with beverages. Chips, salsa, and guacamole were good as always! Fried cheese was just okay-should have been hotter. We were done eating our appies and thought too much time had gone by-sure enough when we checked it had been about 30 minutes. Our server stopped by to say that our food would be up soon and we asked to speak to manager, Jeff. She said they were waiting on my fajitas.   Food arrived in about another 5 minutes. Well, most of it. 2 burgers, ribs and pizza came. Pizza was hot. Burgers and ribs were not. Burgers we way over cooked.  My mom ordered mashed and got fries. Server brought her the mashed pretty quickly and they were nice and hot.   My chicken fajitas came in a few more minutes-sizzlilng hot plate.  I noticed that the chicken looked different from the last time I ordered (I think it was Nov. 2013). The chicken was blonde-no grill marks. Looked like it had been poached. Onions were slightly burnt but that is normal with fajitas. Jeff arrived a few minutes later and listened to our complaints and explained a few things. Chicken different-yes, Chili's has gotten rid of their grills. WOW! Due to carbon footprint.  Pizzas and fajitas are made at the enchilada station. That caused their delay. Other food was ready and sat while waiting on rest. That is not how server is supposed to handle it.  Also, he agreed that the 5 y/o's (very antsy) pizza should have been brought out asap.Also, the server may not have put our order in right away. He checked the ticket when we asked to see him and it had been stamped about 20 minutes earlier. We let him know it had been about 30.  Jeff, again, was very personable, and gracious!  He was awesome! He said he is working on making changes at this location. He took some of the food off the bill.  We did tip the waitress, though definitely not 15%. She failed to get our food out hot and she never asked if we wanted a refill on chips. We will be back to this location, but we will continue to keep track of food delivery time. We do like the food at Chili's though I am concerned over the changes in how they are prepping some of their food. I won't be ordering the fajitas again.
While I really would like to give this place the benefit of the doubt, my 9 year old sister was served raw chicken. It took an hour for our food.
Outstanding personal service from the management to the ladies and gentlemen on the floor.  They all put in all the hard work to make the visit comfortably delightful.

The food portions here are ridiculously small for the price they cost. Also, the chips are really thin and cannot be enjoyed with any dip or salsa.  The only great item of off the menu is the spinach dip. If I had the option to choose between this and a real Mexican place I would. If you are coming here for real Mexican flavors... This is definitely not the place to go. My experience with the food and the wait time was awful.
Great deal right now on their salad, ribs and desert! We went there yesterday with my parents! Great service too. My mom was determine to get a booth even though the host wanted to seat us at a table

Chili's is the best. Their food is always delicious and their prices are affordable. I've never had to wait long gone even with big groups and the waiters have always been really nice. This location ha sales us been a good one and I've been coming here for 11 years. Any time we want a special night out this is where we come. Check it out!

Family and I went out for Grandparents Day, there were 8 of us dining.  Unfortunately, my order was screwed up and out of the eight I'm the one that uses yelp the most!  I ordered the 2 for $20 and asked for a medium rare 6 oz. steak only to receive a well done steak!  Argh!  So, back went my steak there was no way I was going to grind that rubber!  So, sure enough they came back with another it was so rare my daughter kept questioning how could I enjoy eating something that bloody!  I was somewhat uncomfortable but, I was hungry and didn't want to send it back again!  So I ate a raw steak!! Anyways in the end all was good as the manager came over and apologized for my over done steak and said he took it off the bill!  So, I ate for free!  I hope it doesn't happen again because the waiting without half your food does suck, cause everyone else is eating and your not!

Why does this place exist? Seriously. Visited tonight with She who must be obeyed and my clone. Our Betta died, so we thought we'd stop by Chilis for dinner and then go buy a replacement fish. This is our 3rd or 4th time in since it opened some years ago, and every time we come, we leave feeling the same. Disappointed in the food, and a little sorry for the kids that have to sever it. the service was great. The hostess, servers, and busboy were all friendly, professional and attentive. As on other visits, the failure is in the food. it's a combination of bad recipes and poor execution. I got the 3 tacos combo special, and my wife got 2 chicken tacos. The Sprog got a plate of fries and shared with us. I got one fish, one chicken and one Carnitas. The fish was really fishy, just not good or fresh. The chicken and carnitas were better, but tasted like smoke flavoring and salt. The cabbage was the best thing on any of the tacos. The rice and beans were good, but not anything special. My wife's two chicken tacos were also just OK, but kinda wilted and plopped on the plate like no one gave a crap. Overall none of it is ever really bad, it's just never close to good.  I'm sure I'll forget this review in a few years, have another crappy meal, and then realize I should have known better. The boy got his new fish at petco, named him Ron. God knows why, but as long as he's happy.....
We love stopping in to the bar for happy hour or dinner. The staff has always been attentive and the bar staff is generally great and friendly.

Probably my least favorite chilis but after a failed attempt at the macaroni grill next door can't complain too much.  Our waitress was very kind don't get me wrong but she did not come by the table all that much...I had to have the waitress serving a table across from us to refill my drink. I understand she was probably a little busy and her positive attitude definitely made up for it but I would have liked a little more attentiveness.  My grandma got a steak and broccoli but the broccoli was bland. I got the fajitas which were alright..not the best. All in all an average visit but they were pretty busy for a Tuesday night.

I have had bad experiences with this place before but I finally got fed up and decided to right a review on it. Spent 100.00 on dinner for 5 only to find out when I got home that they forgot an order, shorted me on the appetizer and forgot dipping sauces. This place delivers poor service and the portions are measly. Let's just say that I will never order Chili's to-go ever again and probably won't be dining in any time soon. Obviously you can tell from their 2 1/2 stars that they have issues at this location and in looking at the restaurants as whole, they don't score anything above 3 stars.

My wife and I started eating at Chili's in 1980. The food was fantastic and the focus on quality was foremost.  This was true no matter what part of the country we were in. However, over the last 10 years it is clear the beancounters have taken over. The food quality sucks and to be frank we will never eat there again. We made many happy memories with friends and family over the years at Chili's.  It truly saddens me that it has come to this.

Our party of nine was there for lunch today and it was wonderful. Our server was friendly, attentive, and very quick to get refills and bring our food. The food tasted great and everyone in our party was able to find something on the menu that they liked. I had the bottomless soup and salad and thought it was a great deal. We don't visit Chilis often, but now I think we might, as I'm that surprised with the food and service. Thanks for an enjoyable lunch!

My family and I have been here many times in the last decade that we've lived in Corona and service has been up and down which is one of the reasons we don't frequent this place... But, hubby suggested it for dinner so we met there after work!  First of all, my daughter and I sat at the bar at 6:50 and I wanted to order happy hour.  The server advised that happy hour is from 3-7 and I missed the cut off to order!  Wth!!!  I still had 10 minutes, he totally jipped me!  He was nice but disappointed I couldn't get an order in.   We ordered the trio platter for appetizers which included the mini sliders, southwestern egg rolls and onion rings.  All were decent.     Our dinner wasn't served until 7:40, took forever to come.  My husband ordered the fajitas, he likes the and order for every time we have gone there.  My daughters ordered the chicken tacos and mini burger with fries.  And each enjoyed their order as well.  I ordered the sirloin steak with salad.  I ordered it medium.  My steak was over cooked.   Bummed about the visit!!  Cool thing is there are tablets which offer games and ability to pay your check and tip, so the server/cashier is no longer needed for this step.

I have to call 20 times to order carry out. And I'm not even exaggerating. I guess they can't hear the phone but what is the point of offering to-go ordering if you just have to end up coming in to order anyways?

Well my Mom gets a craving for the Chocolate Lava Cake every once in a while so a couple of weeks ago..we go. She got a yummy salad. I got a rib eye steak. Food comes. My salad is good but my steak is raw. Raw raw. Send it back. Still raw. Send it back. Gray & steamed looking.  Management apologizes profusely, but I'm over it. Just take it off the bill & let my Mom eat her cake. But then Chris comes over & insists I just let him personally cook my steak like he does his at home & give him six minutes. Okay. Mom orders another drink. OMG! SOO worth the wait. Absolutely cooked perfectly & honestly one of the best steaks I've ever eaten. Still didn't charge me. Now that's the kind of customer service that makes me want to go back to a place. Thanks Chris!!

My husband and I have been regulars here for years. We just love the bar staff. They are so efficient and friendly that we just love them all. Even though we no longer reside in Corona,  we visit every chance we get.

This place is something else! We were a group of 6 and one of them was my son who is disabled. We were waiting for 20 min when I went to ask how much longer and was told 15-20 min. I said OK. Another group of six walked in shortly after and I over heard the host tell them it will be a wait and the older gentleman with group loudly said "you should of called in earlier" all of sudden they have a table for them. My wife then went to talk to the host and I followed and he tried to say they called in earlier. I said BS and told him what I heard and he acted like he didn't know what was going on. All of a sudden because I threw a fit we had a table. Instead of going somewhere else to wait we stayed. We had asked to talk to the manger earlier but he never came, all of a sudden we are at our table and this guy comes up to us and all he says is "sorry I was in the kitchen cooking" I was like OK! And he walked away. My wife then mentioned that might of been the manager, I said well he didn't present himself as the manager.  Our server was cool, but they ran out of the beer I wanted, I was the last one to get my drink and the last one to get my dinner. When we asked for desert out of the 5 dealers they only had two available.  Won't be going to this place again! It's a joke.

I'm a fan!   Honestly I don't think I have ever been disappointed at a chili's.  The food is always good, service always consistent and this one was no different!   I had the taco's and thought they were quite good.  Our server was fun, prompt and helpful. And the place was packed so it says a lot.

The host seemed bored...it took too long for the food to be served....30 minutes. It wasn't very good...fajitas, the steak was tough, shrimp over cooked. The tea was good and so was our server. We came because their website said they had sweet potato fries. Not anymore.

I would like to start off by saying I have worked in food service, and we were 'that' table. 13 people, 7 of which were kids. We also had coupons. Yeah, ouch. Our server, who I cannot remember the name of, was PHENOMENAL!! Drinks were never empty, she accommodated our difficult coupon situation, and she was flat out amazing with the kids. Could not ask for better service. Whoa, only three stars? Yeah we hooked her up on the tip and if Chili's is reading this, and has any kind of employee rewards based on Yelp reviews, please know that this rating in no way reflects the awesomeness of the server!! The food took well over 30 minutes. When it arrived, it was okay at best. I ordered a guacamole burger. It had way too many jalapenos and was luke-warm. Also, of the 12 plates (two littles shared)  that were brought to the table only 4 were right. 3 of the  7 kids received only entrees and no sides or vice versa. I upgraded to the sweet potato fries and received regular fries. My wife received no ranch. All three burgers at the table were entirely too greasy. We were less than satisfied.  Now for a little food service trick...a lot of people would attribute at least a few of these problems to the server. I, however, did not say anything until the bills were presented. EVERYTHING we ordered on the bill was 100% CORRECT. Absolutely no fault to the delightful server. This Chili's needs to pay more attention to detail on the back of the house. The food took forever, and then it was mostly wrong. Every star earned on this rating came from the overall experience and not the quality or accuracy of the food. We also noticed no managers on the floor. I expected to see some sort of quality control in the front of the house since there was clearly none in the back. Luckily, the servers and host staff have everything pretty much down all by themselves. We will return, thanks in small part to the server. We will return, mostly, because of the convenience and that is sad.

Service was really great, but my friend and I woke up the next morning with food poisoning. Called the manager to let her know something was bad and she was the least bit sympathetic and argued it wasn't their food. Must've been something else. I doubt it.

Food was just as you expect.  But from the beginning the host came up with impressive iPad thing said wait was no longer than 15 minutes.  I was cool with that.  25 minutes later we weren't sure if we should leave or what.  We were sat at 35. Server came over within 5 miles minutes brought our drinks chips and salsa really quick and that's the only good thing that happened.  She disappeared.  Seriously 20 minutes went by other people were sat after us and good their food and we hadn't ordered.  Finally she appears and says she's sorry.  Service recovery?  Ever heard of that?

As with most Chili's restaurants, this location can usually be counted on for decent food and an inviting atmosphere.    I find myself going for a bit of both.  Although it is boring to me to review large, chain establishments, I have been dining at this particular one for over a decade.  That said, I feel this particular restaurant deserves an honest review.  So Jason, you have been eating there for a decade...why only 3-stars then?  Well, because its Chile's...just Chile's...no more, no less, and the corporate philosophy of order and efficiency in the name of the almighty dollar implores all Chile's to be the same.  This one is in a nice place, in a nice area, and over ten years, I still enjoy coming here. The Atmosphere: FUN! This Chile's has a nice bar area that just invites feelings of laid back comfort and fun.  It is a rectangle shaped bar where you can enjoy a good game on the big screen or people watching...Which can be WAY more fun by the way.  The bar is open with a nice color scheme and lots of windows allowing a good amount of light during the day.  Not a dim, dive bar here.  The one problem I have is that this restaurant gets so packed, it can be difficult to find room to stand, let alone sit and order a beer.  One thing I don't like is that the bar becomes a defacto waiting area and if you happen to be sitting at a table close to the lobby it can be annoying.  The Food: I must say, I enjoy their new menu and selections.  From steaks to seafood, Chile's has a bit of everything.  I enjoy their appetizers and appetizer combinations.  Their steaks are tasty and their new garlic butter steak was VERY good.  I am a big fan of their tortilla soup and nachos as well.  Their new menu is inspiring and I found myself wanting to go back to try some of the other new items I saw.  I do feel the desserts look better on the menu than they taste in reality, but hey, they still taste good.  The Service: In ten years, I have NEVER had bad service here.  As I stated before, this location can get packed, but they handle it well.  The bartenders are attentive as is the wait staff.   Overall Chile's is Chile's...One thing that frequenting this restaurant over a decade has taught me that I think I should mention however....  Since 2008, the prices have stealthily crept higher and the portions have been made ever so smaller.  You almost wouldn't notice it, unless you come about once a month like I do.  This past weekend was the most glaring example of it.  Yes, the garlic butter steak was delicious, but what they said was 6 oz was barely over 3.  And no, cooking is not responsible for a 50 percent reduction in size.   It is obvious that Chile's is trying to become as profitable as possible....There is nothing wrong with that....But now, I am starting to notice it.  As long as the food is good, I will probably keep coming back, but I can see a time when I might think twice.   Anyway....TRY THE VEAL!  Just kidding.
Outstanding personal service from the management to the ladies and gentlemen on the floor.  They all put in all the hard work to make the visit comfortably delightful.

Happy Hour ALL DAY SUNDAY!  That's a nice touch. The wife really appreciated this fact. While shopping on a Sunday, we decided to stroll by this place. See them on every corner now (maybe they are related to Starbucks). Always love their $20 deal for 2. It was a little crowded, so we decided to sit in the bar. Service was fair. Food was alright. The biggest plus side was the ALL DAY HAPPY HOUR! My recommendation is to join their club for coupons and deals. They are automatically emailed to your smart phones and show the server. I overheard a guy ordering his dessert to go at another table...

Steven was our waiter tonight in the bar section... Moderately busy but nothing crazy.  Put in my order for a Steak, Mac and Cheese, and Mashed Potatoes.  Didn't tell me that the Mac and Cheese had jalapeños in it and when ordering our initial drinks it took 10 minutes to get them.  When I asked for a refill Steven went to clean his tables first and then forgot about my request.  I had to go up to the bar myself to get my refill.  2 stars are for the overcooked Steak and at least they got the mashed potatoes right....
Food was ok.  The chefs couldn't seem to get the food right nor out on time.  Our server was really nice but overwhelmed with 18 of us.  Not the nicest experience but decent price.

My husband and I frequent the bar often. We love our servers and bartenders. The food is always good and if we ever have an issue our server is more than happy to fix it! I love the Margaritas and chips and salsa...they never fail!

Very disappointed in the lunch service today in the bar. Very understaffed! Everything was wrong in our order. We never got our salad food took an hour to get needless to say we missed our movie! This is when the lazy manager should be out on the floor helping his employees. Won't be returning anytime soonthanks for totally F N up our day chilies!

My wife and I had very little wait time, less than quoted by the hostess. The little electronic kiosk at the table is cool. You can play games, pay your bill and tip, so you don't have to wait for the check. Great service, friendly servers and the steaks are awesome! Great food, great prices and great service. The two for $20 menu is great too with plenty of variety to choose from. I will DEFINITELY be coming back here before going to a steakhouse which are expensive for the most part. My wife and I love Chili's!
Went on a date night with my fiancé and had a great time. It was definitely packed being it a Friday night but service was still good. Especially with the iPad thing now, so awesome!

Went on Wednesday for my neighbor's birthday dinner.  We arrived at around 7:20pm and was informed that it would be a 25-30 minute wait.  Needless to say we decided to wait in the bar and have a drink while our table was prepared.  Aftewr ordering a beer and an iced tea, the bartneder informed of it would be a moment as they have no clean glasses to serve at the moment.  Looking around I found the area under the tv on the right side of the bar to be covered in dirty glasses and dishes.  When the rest of our party arrived, I looked around and found most of the tables were not being bussed by anyone.  After about 25 minutes we finally got our table which was cleared by the hostess.    We ordered our drinks and food.  It took an hour for 6 people to get their food.  One of the people ordered potatoe skins with sliders, and texas egg roll.  the egg roll was soggy, the sliders buns were hard, and the potatoe skins were actually limp.  either they microwaved the food or it sat under the heating lamp for an hour.  Some of our party got their food incorrectly, and most of the food was served cold.  after speaking to the manager about the issues with our food and the overall hygeine of the restaurant he decided to comp us our food.  Needless to say none of the tables around us were cleaned until we made an issue about it with management, with several tables having left over food and dirty dishes on them for over an hour.  I actually watched them move the dishes from one table to another just to make room for some guests.  the bathrroms were disgusting and the floor in the server prep area was covered in food and grease.   Needless to say that since they are willing to leave their dining room in the sort of breeding ground for food born illness and serve food that would not even pass as credible at any prison i will not be back to visit this location. I have forwarded the pictures and the complaint with the health department.  the amount of bacteria and potential virisus that were left out for not only myself but small children to get hold of was horrible.   I hope they clean up there act but based on this visit I can not even give them a second chance.

This is the best chili's I have been to thus far. My waitress was GREAT! The food was delicious. I drove all the way from Los Angeles to this location and caught a flat on the way back. And will I do it again, SHIT YEAH!! LOL #goodeats

The food was outstanding. I order fish that taco's that were cooked perfectly. The reason I did not give 5 stars was the service was a little slow. The Waiter was very nice but I am not sure if he was overwhelmed, but we had to ask 2 different times if someone could ask him to come out. They did not look overly busy. There was no wait, so I am not sure why the service was slow.

I came in yesterday with a few friends and we are in the bar area.  Despite the fact that this section was completely full and busy, we received fast and excellent service! Our appetizers and meals came out promptly and we were all very satisfied with the food.

I wish I could leave negative stars... This was the worst dinning experience my family and I have EVER had!!!! Seems like 90% of the staff called out on New Years Day... Even the cooks!!!! It took 30 min to get seated which in general is no big deal... Even though half the place was empty... Still we sat down... We figured if we would order right away our food would come out quick... NOPE!!! Our server was very nice he was doing his best and said sorry many times for the long wait.... Well after about 45min to an hour our food came out we thought well at least we will get hot food... Again WRONG!!! My buffalo chicken was basically cold.. My sons pizza was not all the way cooked and my sons chicken fingers were shriveled up and gross!!! The food was the worst I have ever had in a dinning out experience! Go somewhere else anywhere else! They need better management!!!!!

Good service but my food arrived  after everyone's food was halfway finished,  not the server's fault, I'm sure is the kitchen. I DID NOT ENJOY MY VISIT TO NIGHT. Everyone In my party got their food and they said it was delicious, I had to take mine to go after I had cancelled, they brought it and I really didn't want to make a scene so I took it. Not be back for a while...

My family and I had the most inattentive, pushy waitress ever! Asked us twice if we wanted to order an appetizer after telling her NO the first time around. I asked for ranch to be brought out with my son's meal, but she forgot it. When we reminded her she said she would bring it out. Five minutes past and she comes back with silverware and stated again that she would be bring ranch. Meanwhile my son is starving because he needs his ranch to eat. My husband notice our waitress chatting it up with another waitress for 10 minutes.  Now I'm fuming, so we asked a different waiter to bring ranch. Finally!!! She brings our ranch after he goes back and tells her.  She didn't even apologize for taking so long, then had the nerve to ask if we wanted sour cream and guacamole for the second time. After, she asked if we wanted dessert but we said no because my husband told her it was my son's birthday and she was already suppose to bring out something. So what happens? Well, she comes back and thanks us for coming in and tells us if we changed our mind about dessert we can still order one on the tablet at our table. This so called waitress SARAH didn't even acknowledge my son's birthday. I looked for a manager to complain, but of course I couldn't find one, so I yelped instead.  DO NOT GO TO THIS CHILI's.
Favorite chilli's everyone's really nice and food is always good. I usually eat in the bar area and have never had a problem with any of the staff.

I am a huge fan of chilis. I love them because they are usually all run the same, and they do a good job. NOT THIS ONE! The service here is horrid, and the servers are all full of attitude and arrogance. I requested a booth for me and my two kids, as chairs just allow my kids to run in circles. I get attitude from the male host saying "well you're gonna wait awhile." Turns out after 30 minutes I ask this new hostess, and the original asshole didn't put my name in.  I finally get seated and my server never shows. 20 minutes later he does, and he must have been told I want a happy camper because he shows up with this major attitude rushing me on my drink order and food order. He never said more than two words to me at a time. The managers there walk around not caring about customers, where other Chilis I go to will have managers going table to table. Not this one. I will never ever ever come back to this restaurant. I encourage anyone on here to stay the hell away. Go to the macaroni grill next door. They have class.

First time going to Chili's and i doubt i ever will again. For one we waited 20 minutes for my wife and i to be seated, no it was not packed, there were plenty of tables open just not clean. It took forever for one person to take the initiative to clean, most of the front door staff greeted and looked around instead of getting the person in charge of cleaning the tables or even a manager or server do it. Second, "world famous baby back ribs?" They're O.K...  And last took a long time to get our food even though again, it was not packed nor half way full...and the server after giving us our food didn't check with us for refills and we had to ask someone else to get our check. Oh yea, the bathrooms are dirty as well, no one cleaned the . Either this place is extremely under staffed, or some of the employees are just lazy. And or have a inadequate manager.

Came here on a Friday night and the service is awful.  Ordered artichoke dip and it arrived cold.  Had to track the waitress to let her know about the artichoke dip.  Asked twice for refills and still waited 10 minutes for the drinks.  Soup and salad was good but the service killed this visit.  I am usually very understanding but they weren't that busy - six empty tables in our area alone.

this place should get no stars my family and i use to love this place after the last two times it was the worst how can a cook let under cooked chicken go to a table if the manager reads this heres a tip HIRE SOMEONE THAT KNOWS HOW TO COOK i will never go to this location again
We went here for Sunday lunch. I got a cheese burger and fries, my husband got the ribs. The food was okay, nothing special. Our server was nice but our food took a bit longer than usual.

I have been to many Chili's locations and I must say that the service in Corona (15 fwy and Calajco) has the best service by far.  Friendly and fast.   Being a single mom, I love the fact that they take the time to say hi and have an actual conversation with my 7 year old son.

my boyfriend and i go here for lunch once in awhile and i really like the bartender that we get when we go. i should've gotten her name but shes awesome. im always concerned about calories when i go out to eat and she just really seems to know her stuff when it comes to the menu, and the low calorie cocktails. she's got darker hair, average height, and thin. the food there of course is great. id recommend their lime chicken soup. SO good and low in calories. and their worlds freshest margarita is great. their skinny margarita isnt bad, but not a lot of alcohol in it. For just a couple more calories you can get their "worlds freshest margarita" with double the alcohol.

There's really nothing special about this Chili's compared to other Chili's. I just wanted to write a review about this place because it was the first time I ever ate out this far. Given that it's practically in the middle of no where... yeah there are a few big name stores like Costco next door, but it's still pretty much out in the middle of no where.  The one thing about this Chili's is that, if not paying attention, I would never of saw it...since it's tucked away pretty far back from the main road.  I'm only giving this place a 2 star because the service was very friendly.

I took my daughter here last night after some shopping for some needed girl time.  We decided to share a plate because they offered a "create your own combo" for 16.95 and we could both get what we wanted.  She had the Honey BBQ Sirloin and I requested the Lime Shrimp.  The mashed potatoes were good, and the veggies were not overdone, but everything was just barely warm.  One bite of the shrimp.  Yee blah! it went straight back, it was raw!  I still can"t get the yuck out of my mouth from that one.  I tasted her sirloin and all I could taste was the sauce which was mediocre at best.    I replaced my dish with Margarita Chicken, which took forever to come out.  It was just OK, too dry, even the black beans and rice were dry. Really no flavor to speak of.
Food totally sucks. Lil ass portions... not the best wait staff...

Food was good... Pretty bad service though.  Chili's has always been fresh, hot and tasty... But I've never experienced poor customer service when at a lunch meeting.  The manager seemed to be overran with a stronger personality of our server.  She was rude and obnoxious to him, and ultimately looked like a jerk when she got multiple plates incorrectly cooked and/or prepared.  I will eat at Chili's again... Just not this one.
Typical chili's place just came in for a quick bite to eat between shopping with my girls. The staff were extremely friendly and attentive to us.

I read some of the previous reviews about this Chili's which have been negative. I'm happy to say I had a great experience at Chili's. We went here on Valentine's Day which was also the day of the Allstars basketball game. There was no wait, we were seated immediately and choose to sit the bar area to watch the tv's. Although we didn't have perfect service it was good service. Our food was great, although 3 out of 4 of us ended up taking home doggie bags because we couldn't finish it (now we have lunch tomorrow).  Overall I would say it was a great dinner and we'll definitely be back!

We got here around 5pm on a Wednesday, we figured cause it's a weekday it'd be fast on getting our food; well it still took long just as if it was the weekend. Maybe they were short on staff. Everything else was good, the food is always delicious.

This chilis sucks. I will NOT be returning. My order that I placed to pick up was ALL wrong. My burger was plain. Literally bread and meat. I did NOT modify this burger at all. My soup was cold and my fries were freezing. To make it even better, when I asked for a spoon to go along with my soup, he informed me they didn't have any for me & asked if he could get me some napkins? I said uh... You realize I have soup right? He just looked at me. FINALLY he says something to a manager, and she gets me a metal spoon... I am beyond disappointed with my service here. He was either new, dumb or just had no desire to help anyone. Again, this chilis sucks!

Came two weeks ago. Food was awesome. Not today. Maybe cuz they were busier then normal? Got a beef taco and chix enchilada. They put the taco on top of enchilada which made it soggy. The food took too long to come out. My sister ordered a salmon well done. It was not. My husbands patron margarita was not worth it. He said it was too sweet. It comes in a cute patron bottle but too much ice which waters it down. The dessert was disappointing. The lava cake tasted like it had been frozen/refrigerated for too long. The cookie dessert with ice was not hot at all. The best part was our waiter.
Very good happy hour deals in the bar! Server/bartender is very friendly. Definitely recommend this place for happy hour.

My husband and I came here one night, because it had been a while since we came to Chili's. We decided to seat ourselves in the bar area. The waitress was very friendly and cool. We put in our drink orders, it came fast. We put in our food order and started playing the little video game on the table ($0.99, I think that goes on your bill). Well, 45 minutes later, we were so caught up in the games that we forgot about our food. Apparently, so did our waitress. We asked a different waitress where our food was? She went to go check on it and brought it to us. Our food was cold. So sad. We were so hungry and upset. We told our waitress what happened and she asked us if we wanted to leave? Yep. No offer to remake, just if we wanted to leave. So we did.

Had a really good time with friends and family. Great spot for unwinding during the week with a couple of drinks. The service was good, the drinks were really good! I had a presidente margarita and a regular margarita! Delicious! We had appetizers. Guacamole with chips and salsa. Perfect snacking to quench my thirst with the cold margarita I had! Will definitely be going back! Yum

I love chilli's, usually. Today, waitress was great but food, not so hot. Salad had brown leaves; cheese sticks were tasteless, accompanying maranera Sauce had a funky taste to it. Steak was over cooked. Chicken enchilada Soup was boring and bland. Redeeming factors: chips and salsa, classic toasted turkey sand which, loaded mashed potatoes and very attentive staff! :)
This place use to be good. Not a good experience any longer.  Food and service at Denny's par

Two for $20 how can you beat that?! The salsa is great. The service is great every time I come here. The only complaint is that it seems to always be busy and they don't give accurate waiting times but what restaurant does?

I've been here about 4 times & each time service has been AWEFUL. It took so long for our food to come out and the waitresses do not come and check on you for refills or any other service. Never going back here again.

I was there last Monday with my mom and we were both beyond disappointed with the service. I gave two stars because I enjoyed my food but it took about an hour and a half to get it. We ordered our food (can't remember his name for the life of me) and we did the 2 for 20. We ordered our food way before anyone around us did and got our appetizer rather quick. But I noticed a couple of families ordered the same deal but they received their entree in a timely fashion. An hour passes by and I'm still chomping away at some chips because I ate all the guacamole. We both ordered the noodles and by the time our server finally came by after ignoring us he said "oh they burned the noodles, they'll be out shortly." I don't know how you burn noodles but they managed to do so! By the time our food came out we just told them to put it in a togo box and left. I most likely won't be returning to this location
I love and support this Chili's because they are involved in multiple local fund raisers for great causes.  But the good food and service definitely brings me back here on regular basis.
high prices and little portions of flavorless food. it's ok not all that . been here several times to try diffrent things wasn't all that great.

I haven't been to Chilli's in a very long time...years I think.  I wasn't such a big fan back then, but this last visit sure changed that for me.                  Love the soup and salad deal, which comes with chips & salad....all three are all-you-can-eat, and for less then $7.  We've had the ribeye steak here, and its pretty good without all the hoopla of adding sauces on it.  Nice, simple, juicy steak, with great sides.  The chicken wings are always good.  My cousin ordered the appetizer quesadillas that were nicely overstuffed, and her bf ordered the appetizer (I think its an app) sliders. They've got a 2 meals for $20 =D So far so good, we look forward to returning every now and then.  The service is eh...depends on who you have.  However, overall we're satisfied.
Good food conveniently located in a great shopping center.  What more can you ask for? Went for lunch and had great service.

Horrible service we walked out!  Chili's closes at 11p.m. Last night we walked in to no hostess, then proceeded to be ignored for 10 minutes. We locked eyes with over 10 employees. One girl was off her shift and came up to the podium and ignored us! Really? You can't say someone will be right with you? We we're intentionally ignored most likely I thought so we would sit in the bar area. Well, it's 9 and they didn't close till 11! I didn't want to sit in the bar we were celebrating a birthday! A tall man with grey hair finally came over no apology just a blunt do you wanna sit in the bar for happy hour? We said no thank you. He rolled his eyes and turned his back to us and then turned back around with a irritated look and said well there gonna have to clean off a table for you. As there were tons of empty booths and tables. We said that's fine and he said unless you can just sit in the bar there are booths and tables and its the same service... Ummm no it isn't! The bar is loud,  people are drinking and its a social area with t.v. and drunk people! We already said we wanted to sit on the regular side! We decided to tell the guy no, we will just go next door to Macaroni  Grill. We went over to Mac Grill and we were greeted and seated with no huffs and puffs. Chilis is such a disappointment reminded me of TGIF at Dos Lagos (Epic Fail) its sad that these people are even employed!

I love the margaritas here... However this trip I ordered a bacon cheeseburger with a turkey patty instead of the hamburger patty... First they gave me a burger but caught the mistake and had it remade with a  turkey patty.. My boyfriend and I wondered why it was taking so long.... When we finally got our food the turkey party was way over cooked and didn't have cheese or bacon on it. I was so hungry at this point that I just let it go. It's not like we could have gotten our servers attention anyway since he was so busy...  It's just frustrating... We couldn't even get refills on our drinks. Now I hear the table behind us sending things back that were made wrong.. We love coming here... And honestly, this experience makes me rethink coming back.  Maybe it was just a bad night or they were short staffed... I don't know.

My husband, our 4 month old son, and I attempted to eat at this Chili's tonight. We were seated by a host (didn't catch his name but he had large plugs in his earlobes hiding his gauged ears - he was very professional, got us a sling for our baby, and sat us immediately - kudos to him, he's the only reason I didn't give this place one star).  The issue was that after we were sat, we waited in our booth for 12-15 minutes without so much as a greeting from any server. Several servers passed by us (one in particular to drop off food to a table next to us, another who took orders for a table of 8 sitting across from us, and a third who asked the table on the OTHER side of us if their party was doing okay), but not one of them took any notice to the fact that we were sitting there. A simple, "Hi, I'm so-and-so, I'll be your server tonight, I'll be right back" or "Hi, your server will be right with you" would have made a BIG difference.  Also, the entire time we were sitting there, the MANAGER was chatting with the table of 8 about traveling outside the country. I sincerely hope she enjoys her trip to Guatemala.  My husband and I have both worked in several restaurants as servers, and the average required greet time runs at about 2-3 minutes... not 12-15. We left, advising the host, previously mentioned, why we were leaving. I love Chili's and have never waited that long for a greet. Someone needs a training refresher... we will not be eating at this particular establishment again.

The waiters here are a little aggressive about taking your order, but I guess they just want to hurry up the process. It was my first time having dry rub ribs here and they were pretty great. The only downfall is that their restrooms were out of stock of everything...No toilet paper, no paper towels, I was surprised they even had soap left over to wash my hands.
Food is good and people are nice, but we had a table of liberals across the way from us and I am still trying to recover from that traumatic experience.

Worst experience  at a chilis! Worst food ever! Took and 1 hr and 10 minutes to get partial meal. On chicken sandwich bread hard and burnt, no bacon. On fajitas meal took took 15 minutes to get the tortilla. By the time they came rest of party was almost done.

The hostess was unfriendly. The food took forever and they twice brought the wrong thing out. Our waiter manny was rude and told one of our party that she forgot to remind him to bring her side dish. What??!! Slow on refills. Food was alright. We had three kids at our large table so we were using 3 on the little electronic games (2 were in use) and he came right over and took the one my daughter was using. We said why can't he take the one no one is using? He said that one belongs to the other table and marched off with it. Did it matter? I didn't even grab it off the table he took it to. And we grabbed a third because the other one that was suppose to be at our table was in the window behind us broken. Anyway, we had three different tabs and we were leaving tips which we already thought he didn't deserve when he grabbed the other electronic game from my nephew and then the one in the window saying how it was all broken. Excuse me??? It was broke already that's why I borrowed the other one you jerk. I pulled the cash tip off the table. Here's a tip manny, stop taking stuff out of little children's hands and worry about your service not sucking.

I want to say first, we LOVE Chilis, but horrible from start to finish, take that back, 5 minute wait was a 5 mInute wait.  Waited too long for food, order wrong, didn't get order.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!

I'm not a big fan, but I often get gift cards from my Citi Rewards to this place.  The food is great, the service is okay....but I can't wrap my head around why I'm not a big fan of this place.  I think it's because it's bright and noisy.   The tables are squeezed so close to each other than you can hear everyone talking around you.....so everyone talks louder and louder.....  Oh, and the wait staff tends to take food off your table before you've eaten it.  I feel like they try and get you served, fed, and out the door fast.  The last time we went here the waiter took a quarter of my burger and some fries off the table as if I was done eating.  I made him bring me back a new container of fries...  I of course didn't get my burger back.
Not very good food - this location should be looked at by corporate. Horrable service all ten times we've tried ( no more - we give up) Food always cold and never prepared the same twice
Great 2 for 20.  Daughter and I visit Chilli's on occasion.  We are very happy with their service and meal deals.

It's a chain restaurant so you have to temper your expectations. The chips and salsa are always good. There is a fairly decent variety on the menu and it is usually pretty good. Service can be a crapshoot. I have been coming here since the place opened and sometimes (especially if it is a waitperson who has seen me before), the service is great. Other times, especially with new staff, it seems to take forever.
