It seems the restaurant staffs the dining area depending on how many customers they expect so if it is a little crowded and they are not adequately staffed, everything seems to slow down.

Got to be one of Corona's best eateries for sure. Something sure to please every palate. Our family's favorite dining spot. Only way anyone could complain is if they had to wait for a table. Must have the best training of any restaurant in the area. The food is always cooked just right and the service is spot on and anticipatory. Adult meals $7& up, kids mostly less than $5. Need I say more. Poor reviewers must just want it all to themselves.
BF and I sat at the bar. service was super slow and bar was barely full. we had to wave down the bartender to order beer and again to order food and then again for water. REALLY!! Come on!!
Love the chips and salsa the chicken tacos are really good here boneless wings are great also is the chicken chrispers good service ;)

My family and I have come here often, and in the last three visits, the service has gotten worse and worse. Last night, we went at around 6:30 and there weren't too many people there so we were expecting the service to be a bit quicker than it was. We ordered our drinks, appetizers and main dishes the first time our waitress came around. The drinks came with good time, the appetizers took a bit long but the main dishes took almost 45 min to come out. And the only reason it did come out was because we told the manager we wanted to pay for what we HAD gotten and leave. When the food arrived, it wasn't hot and we received no apologies from our waitress or the manager. When it was time to pay the check, it took another 20 min before anyone came along. Now I don't expect free things, but in my own experience working in customer service and bad experiences at other restaurants, some sort of compensation is usually offered following terrible service like this. But of course, we saw no such thing. Aside from the service, other problems we came across were hygienic such as a dirty table, dead insects along the window next to the table and chewing gum literally hanging from the bottom of the table. As you can probably guess, my family and I will not be returning to this establishment any time in the seeable future.

I couldn't tell you about the food cuz there was over an hour wait to be seated (on a Saturday before 5 is kinda ridiculous). So I immediately went next door the the macaroni grille and was seated immediately and continued to have a wonderful dinner!!!

We have always been a huge fan of the Texas Cheese fries! Naturally when it is my birthday I ask to come here. This time I am not sure if it was the large party they had next to us or maybe one of the 6 servers we had were too busy??? At first it was impossible to get refills then all of a sudden they were all at the table and at one point we counted 15 cups for 6 people. We really only needed two refilled. Still the evening was ok, then they took almost 40 min for chicken strips and fries to come out. I begged my father to come to Chillis he wanted to take me somewhere else. It took sooooo long for his food to come out that I felt bad and went and paid the check so he wouldn't. Ugggghhh so bummed. Just a note, while the service seemed to lack organization the hostess and the six or so servers were very friendly. This two server thing really isnt working for you guys... Maybe old fashioned is better??? Oh and just my opinion the kiosks aren't cool!!

Everyone knows what a cheap bastard I am.  So if I can make something myself and I get more of it and it's cheaper, then I'd rather do that.  But I went out here for a special occasion so I didn't have much choice in the matter. I ordered chicken strips with fries and although they were good and the waitress was extremely nice and very attentive, I just didn't like the idea of having to pay $8 for some chicken strips.  At home, you don't get three different dipping sauces to go with your homemade strips, but you're getting way more strips for your money.  Sure, what's 8 bucks when you're saving time and effort?  But every cheap bastard knows that you shouldn't have to pay that much for something so simple. There's nothing extraordinary about this particular Chili's so if you're a fan, there's absolutely nothing wrong with it.  But if you're a cheap bastard like me, you'd better order something you can't make at home.  Otherwise, you're gonna feel like I feel and wonder if you should have ordered something else.

I really like the food at chili's and it's nice that they offer a gluten free menu (regardless of how minimal).  However every time I go the wait staff is sub par.  AND usually the waiter gets switched on us about halfway through the meal for another sub par waiter.  EVERY time we go this happens.  Do they even allow a waiter to complete one full meal? The problem with this is they don't know what you ordered, or what you're drinking, you have to re-explain yourself, if like me you have food allergies.  It's just annoying.  Meh.  I've had better service, but the food is tasty.  If you don't really care about service, then I recommend this location.

large portions, incredibly low prices, great service. i have only gotten food to go from here but still it has very nice service. strangely enough chili's restaurants don't have any ovens. everything is either fried or grilled. a cheeseburger meal around 6$ which id still lower than most fast food chains. if you use their coupons the food becomes extremely cheap. i like this place. overall a nice place to eat.

I took the bf here for his birthday one year and our LAME waitress said she wouldn't sing but would bring out a chocolate shake for him (too cheap for cake??). Not the type of hospitality I was looking for on this celebratory day. We ordered their baby back baby back (you know the song) ribs and onion blossom and played JENGA with the leftover bones to entertain ourselves. The meat on the ribs was dry and covered up with plenty of sauce (which is characteristic of bad BBQ) and the onion bloom was saltier than the hairy, sweaty back of a morbidly obese man. At least the chocolate shake was good.

Have  been here before and it has been horrible not today it was good. The difference is the staff Meagan the host was a great help, it really dose make a difference if you have a good team they all helped each other and I seen a different today. Other then the cauliflower appetizer a bit burnt it was a lot better today the Manager (man ) didn't get his name was also very helpful cleaning tables and really helping out his crew

I got the sunrise burger. In the picture, it looked like a huge, delicious burger, but i was very disappointed when it came to the table.  The burger was much smaller than I expected. It looked similar to something you could get at a Wendy's drive through. And the fries order was equally as small. For $12, you're better off going through a drive through and super size the meal.
The waiter was good but man that food was gross! The chicken wasnt cooked good at all and ny girl got food poisonings from the salmon wont be going back

Don't even bother, what a disgusting place. The bathroom was dirty, the waitress kept piling up dirty dishes on the table in the middle of the dining room, why? Take those dirty, filthy dishes in the back, I mean how lazy can you be? The whole time we were there that big table never got bussed. It just got piled up with more dirty dishes. The fully loaded potato soup is a joke, not unless you like potato broth with bits of onion, bacon and cheese floating around. I won't even bother with the chicken salad I had. This restaurant chain needs to close down.  Hum...buh  bye!
The food was gross, couldn't find the restaurant we wanted so just went here. Bland, ugly food. The servers was really nice though. I guess you get what you pay for, cheap freezer food.
This place is cool. I have had better and I have had worse. It is not nasty but it is not great. It is just mediocre. I like their chips and salsa.

A very generous 2-stars for my most recent visit only due to the good service and Bloody Mary from the bar.  The rest of the experience was really limp: 1. Pasta with chicken was soooo DRY that I had to request a side of Alfredo sauce just to make it edible.  Who are these cooks who send stuff like this out? 2. Tiny piece of garlic toast.....about 50% of the normal size. Dry with little flavor 3.  Side order of the usually yummy street corn was old, dried out and cold upon arrival.  It looked like it was left over from the lunch crowd and was being recycled for dinner. 4.  Nasty men's bathroom with pee all over the floor as well as overflowing towel baskets.  Spoke with a male manager who told me they have NO regular schedule for cleaning it and that it is more or less an honor system of which servers want to do it.  WHAT?  NO server wants to ever be on bathroom cleanup duty, so it will be constantly avoided all day long UNLESS there are specific times and people assigned to that task.   WHY is this location so inconsistent with its food product, service and cleanliness?  No wonder it only has 2.5 starts.
We can't just stop coming to Chillis, they have the best happy hour. My son loves to play games on the table kiosk. Great atmosphere and always great service.
One of my favorite and frequently visited restaurants. I love the device. Manny is my favorite waiter. Always knows what we want and has drinks and chips with salsa ready before I get seated.

Came here because I was shopping in the center it's located in. We barley waited before we got seated, our services was amazing food was yummy and our waitress was quick with greetingnus They kept our drinks filled our waitress was very sweet and amazing. If your in the area I highly recommend this loaction.

Had high hopes for this location, since it is the nearest one to my home. Greeted immediately and we were seated right next to the restrooms. Seriously? More than a dozen tables vacant and you sit us in the booth next to the restrooms? Whatever.  On to the food.. Drinks were okay. Chips and salsa okay.  Mom's ribs were bland as hell. My steak was bland as hell as well. My shrimp?  Not even on the plate. Asked about it and our server blamed the cook. He came back 15 minutes later with a tiny ass plastic cup filled with 3 tiny ass shrimp.  He almost dropped the tiny ass plastic cup filled with shrimp and only caught it by STICKING HIS FILTHY HANDS INTO THE CUP AND TOUCHING ALL MY SHRIMP WITH HIS NASTY, FILTHY HANDS.  I wanted to vomit. Did he expect me to eat that? I don't know where his hands have been. Why couldn't he have put the shrimp in a small bowl? Instead of a plastic cup! I don't understand. This is not a fast food restaurant. Are your workers so lazy they don't want to wash a small bowl?  By the end of the meal, I was ready to get out of there. I should have trusted the reviews on here and went elsewhere. Big mistake! Never coming here again. FILTH!!!

On my first visit to this location, after reading previous reviews I was skeptical BUT I had the best experience ever.  For starters there was no wait, secondly i got seated and offered drinks within 2 mins of being there. ALSO best server I've ever had at chilis or any other restaurant. His name is Manny, his honest recommendations and very friendly customer service skills made my experience pleasant.   I will definitely come back and also keep in mind that the way you're treated will reflect on the initial treatment you give them.  Customer is not always right. A lot of you are either way too picky, impatient or just plain demanding.  Anyways Chili's this was a great visit. Thank you

This is only for delivery service on grub hub but I'm posting on here because it's regarding manager Ruben. We ordered 2 days in a row and they messed up both our orders my daughters burger she wanted only mayo, cheese, avocado and meat but it came with mustard, lettuce , onion, tomato and no mayo! My daughter didn't eat it. I ordered a margarita grilled chicken with beans and rice and I got a margarita salad. Then today they forgot our appetizer and dips for chicken tenders. The guy on grub hub was really nice and helpful when he spoke with Ruben all he offered was $15 in restaurant coupon. When we asked for it to be re delivered correctly he said all he could do was the coupon. Anyway I knew there was a reason I haven't been to chilis in several years.
We love coming to this chilies it's a family affair and we always have a great time they serve fresh food fresh food fast and delicious!!!

What the hell happend to this place. Whoever redesigned the menu should be fired.  99% of the food here etheir has BBQ Sauce, Pico De Gallo, Black Beans or Corn. This place was always a solid contender in the Junk Restaurant Class  (Buffalo Wild Wings, Applebee's, TGIF) but sadly this place doesn't even make the cut for last place. I rather go to Sizzler. When these people put together a decent or even half assed menu maybe I'll come back. MENU FAIL!

WOW I came here for my birthday, and I am very surprised that a corp/ franchise did so well. the waiter Mathew was really cool, talkative and engaging. Made us feel really good. I have had a lot of bad experiences with restaurants and this was a good change for once.  I will be going back more often to this chili's since the service and food are so good. I made sure to tell the manager how happy I was with our service. usually you call the manager to give a negative comment. But she was happy to hear how good her staff was also. BTW the margaritas are really good and $5 on thursdays.

It's not a surprise this place only has 2 stars. Service is slow even when it's not real busy. You would think an establishment would want people to come back especially since there is quite a bit of competition in the area. Maybe since it's a large corporation it's easier to absorb the loss. I recently read an article that the bigger box sit down restaurants are failing with the millennials (I'm not a millennial) and this place is making me realize why.  You think every bar, restaurant or service related business would do whatever it takes to keep em coming back! This like minded millennial won't be back anytime soon.
Empty tables and wait time to be seated is 15 to 20 mins. What the heck rudiculous. The hostess said she had to many people  to seat

Would not recommend doing an online order. Did an order and took 30 mins to be ready then sat in chilis for another 10 with other customers. Would of been better off just sitting down. Got home with food and missing utensils, napkins and order is wrong. Good job, Lesson leaned.

Our waitress Cassandra was amazing. One of the nicest greatest waitresses ever had. The food was good we ordered a lot. They had some good deals and we ordered an appetizer and the deals came with dessert.  Food was good but fajitas needed more sauce like on the veggies how they used to do it back in the day. Last time I went was the same, hardly any sauce on the chicken fajitas.  Kindly mentioned it to her and she offered to have it redone for me or if I wanted the sauces. To make it easier asked for the sauces. She was very kind and nothing was an inconvenience for her. She was just there to serve you and give you a great experience. Well she did. The fajitas tastes better with more sauce. Thank you Cassandra! We left full and happy.
